fields.description:
I tried running the latest eucaconsole dev build (eucaconsole-4.0.1-0.0.470.20140618git7396e0f1.el6.noarch) and it is failing.  The previous build was working:  eucaconsole-4.0.0-0.0.468.20140606gitc323a3aa.el6.noarch.  If I try to access the console web page, I get this error: 502 Bad Gateway nginx/1.0.15.  I also tried to remove the pid file in /var/run/eucaconsole but that did not help.  There are no log entries in /var/log/eucaconsole.log.  

I see this in "/var/log/eucaconsole_nginx_access.log":
{code}
10.5.1.42 - - [18/Jun/2014:11:50:17 -0700] "-" 400 0 "-" "-"
10.5.1.42 - - [18/Jun/2014:11:50:17 -0700] "-" 400 0 "-" "-"
10.5.1.42 - - [18/Jun/2014:11:50:17 -0700] "-" 400 0 "-" "-"
10.5.1.42 - - [18/Jun/2014:11:50:17 -0700] "-" 400 0 "-" "-"
10.5.1.42 - - [18/Jun/2014:11:50:17 -0700] "-" 400 0 "-" "-"
10.5.1.42 - - [18/Jun/2014:11:50:17 -0700] "-" 400 0 "-" "-"
10.5.1.42 - - [18/Jun/2014:11:50:17 -0700] "GET /instances/i-fbff5a7d HTTP/1.1" 502 575 "https://10.111.5.170" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/35.0.1916.153 Safari/537.36"
10.5.1.42 - - [18/Jun/2014:11:50:18 -0700] "GET /favicon.ico HTTP/1.1" 502 575 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/35.0.1916.153 Safari/537.36"
{code}

I see this in /var/log/eucaconsole_nginx_error.log:
{code}
2014/06/18 11:50:17 [error] 18495#0: *2556 connect() failed (111: Connection refused) while connecting to upstream, client: 10.5.1.42, server: localhost, request: "GET /instances/i-fbff5a7d HTTP/1.1", upstream: "http://127.0.0.1:8888/instances/i-fbff5a7d", host: "10.111.5.170", referrer: "https://10.111.5.170"
2014/06/18 11:50:18 [error] 18495#0: *2556 connect() failed (111: Connection refused) while connecting to upstream, client: 10.5.1.42, server: localhost, request: "GET /favicon.ico HTTP/1.1", upstream: "http://127.0.0.1:8888/favicon.ico", host: "10.111.5.170"
{code}
fields.summary: eucaconsole fails to start due to missing locale folder

comments.body: [~ccassler], what version of openssl do you have installed?

Assigned to kgill by gholms
Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/786
That looks good, at least as far as the tarball goes.  [~alice], would you please give packages a try?

The latest fix broke packaging because it tried to put files in /usr/eucaconsole/locale.  I reproduced this problem with the following commands:

{code}
% python setup.py build
% mkdir /tmp/foobar
% python setup.py install --skip-build --root=/tmp/foobar
% ls /tmp/foobar/usr
{code}

Let me comment on the change I put in to help with the general understanding. The change I put in was to include the eucaconsole/locale directory in the files copied to the package directory. When I tested this on a CentOS box with no previous eucaconsole installed, I ran "python setup.py install". The result was that files were copied to /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole, including code and locale.

If the above steps are what packaging does to build a package, I'll try those to see if we get the desired result. We can tweak accordingly.

update: Tried the above steps and see what you are talking about. I wonder why it doesn't do that when --root is not set? I wonder if there's an easy way to query setuptools to get the proper directory for our method in setup.py (looking at docs)

I haven't been able to get the files copied into the code area. The only path to that seems to be making locale directories into package by adding empty __init__.py files and treating the files as package data.

The other option is to use the standard directories for locale and tell pyramid about them. See: http://docs.pylonsproject.org/docs/pyramid/en/latest/api/config.html?highlight=add_translation_dirs

I'll test this since I think this would work just fine.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/790

That's an odd failure. It is missing one of the templates, which should be in /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/templates. Mind checking that directory?
Another thing, are there eucaconsole files under /usr/share/locale? You'd need to drill down into the individual directories to find them.

This is something we should try. Perhaps @gholms can review for spec-file correctness
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole-rpmspec/pull/1
[~kgill] could you please review and merge this pull request? That way we will see if packages are building correctly.

[~dkavanagh], [~alice]: I don't understand why we're including the /usr/share/locale folder in the package spec, since that folder stores the locale files for the OS, not for the 4.0 console.  Or does the installation copy the console's locale files to /usr/share/locale ?
[~kgill], the /usr/share/locale that's being included is relative to the --root option passed into the "setup.py  install" command, so it only captures the locale files that setup.py puts there.

A program's locale files generally go in /usr/share/locale/$LANG/LC_$CATEGORY/$DOMAIN.mo, which, in eucaconsole's case, means /usr/share/locale/*/LC_MESSAGES/eucaconsole.mo.  There is standard packaging code that handles enumerating all that (see my commentary in [~dkavanagh]'s pull request); the only thing holding it up now is that {{setup.py install}} shouldn't be installing the .po and .pot files.
ic. I can filter those out.
I'm passing to Garrett to sort out the rpm spec file changes. I installed the latest packages this morning and the eucaconsole.mo files were not in the /usr/share/locale subdirectories as expected.

The reason packages didn't pick the locale files up is because running {{python setup.py sdist}} on a system running RHEL 6 produces a tarball with different contents than running it on your OS X machine.  Specifically, it lacks the locale directory, which consequently makes the package fail to build.  I suspect that means the fix you put in wants to use functionality that is missing in either setuptools 0.6.10 or python 2.6.  Can you think of a fix that will work correctly on RHEL 6?

I ran my tests of the setup.py code on a CentOS 6.5 system specifically so I could build in a "correct" environment. However, I'm not that familiar with the package building procedure, so that's where I needed your help. Given your example in a previous comment, it seemed like the -root option was being provided to the "install" command. I made changes to ensure that the right files were copied to that new root location along side the regular package files. After that, I don't know how that gets turned into a package. Maybe we could simply go through the process sometime today and we could come up with a solution.

[~gholms] I just checked and I was using this version of setuptools on centos 6.5

Version     : 0.6.10
Release     : 3.el6

It's sdist that is breaking, not install.  Here's an overview of the build process:

#  ``python2 setup.py sdist'' from inside the source tree creates a tarball that goes on the web site.  No further parts of the build process have access to git.
#  That tarball gets stuffed into a source RPM.
#  The RPM build process explodes the tarball, chdirs into it, and runs ``python2 setup.py build''.
#  The RPM build process creates a temporary directory and runs ``python2 setup.py install -O1 --skip-build --root $RPM_BUILD_ROOT'' to install all files needed for the build.
#  The RPM build process copies the following files:
    ##  conf/console.default.ini -> $RPM_BUILD_ROOT/etc/eucaconsole/console.ini
    ##  (init script)            -> $RPM_BUILD_ROOT/etc/rc.d/init.d/eucaconsole
    ##  eucaconsole.py           -> $RPM_BUILD_ROOT/usr/bin/eucaconsole
    ##  (new file)               -> $RPM_BUILD_ROOT/var/log/eucaconsole.log
    ##  (new dir)                -> $RPM_BUILD_ROOT/var/run/eucaconsole
#  Everything under $RPM_BUILD_ROOT then gets added to the final package.

I have this fix for the MANIFEST.in to properly copy the locale files;
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/798
I've verified the packages now install the proper locale files.

I see that the templates directory *is* missing which would explain why master_layout.pt isn't found. Let me see where that goes missing. My guess is that the templates are not an actual python package and don't get included explicitly. Not sure why this ever worked before.

@gholms, Did the process used to generate the 4.0 package differ from what we are doing now? 

FWIW, static directory is also missing, so that's a lot of stuff we used to include in the build which is no longer included. 

If we've migrated from an old process that included static and template files, even though they aren't proper python package, then we'll need to see about including those in a separate directory like we did in 3.x (GUI-582)

The changes to the packaging process since 4.0.0's release include a version bump and the locale work done for this bug:  https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole-rpmspec/compare/6a3c6fc870f2f7b7d13b4cd4de297688ed546108...develop

In particular, no invocations of setup.py have changed.  Could one of the recent changes to setup.py have broken things somehow?

I just tested with the 4.0.0 version of setup.py, but the current codebase and templates and static files *are* copied. Investigating further.
Just ran through 8 versions of setup.py up to current develop... in all cases, templates and static are copied. That's just running the "install" function. Will test now with complete package build process that uses sdist
When following the sdist route, I notice the templates and static directories are in the tarball, but do not get copied during the "install" step. Trying to determine why.
I've just installed the package from http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/builds/eucaconsole/branch/develop/centos/6/x86_64/ and the templates and static files are there.
